title: Trump trashes Jan 6. committee. Hear committee member's response
description: Rep. Jamie Raskin (D-MD), a member of the January 6th Select Committee, responded to former President Donald Trump trashing the committee's work in a 12-page response.

title: Why Fox started covering the Jan. 6 hearings
description: After declining to air the January 6 committee's prime time hearing, Fox News decided to run day two of the panel's proceedings.  CNN media analyst Bill Carter joins Victor Blackwell to discuss why the outlet shifted its stance.

title: Gorillas chase German shepherd guest in zoo enclosure
description: A German shepherd became trapped inside a gorilla habitat at the San Diego Zoo Safari Park. According to park officials, it was one of two dogs running loose inside the zoo.

title: Missing pair in remote Amazon were likely victims of 'malice', says Brazil's president
description: The vanished British journalist and Indigenous affairs expert who went missing in a remote region of the Amazon are unlikely to be found alive, Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro said on Monday, adding that he believes some "malice" was done to them.

title: China urges college graduates to work in villages as urban unemployment soars
description: China is urging college graduates to seek jobs in the countryside as youth unemployment in urban areas soars to the highest level in history.

title: First UK flight sending asylum-seekers to Rwanda to go ahead after appeal fails
description: The United Kingdom's controversial plan to send asylum-seekers to Rwanda as early as Tuesday is set to go ahead after the Court of Appeal in London confirmed an earlier decision to deny an injunction to block the first flight.

title: Bystanders thwart robbery and rescue woman in Brazil
description: Surveillance video shows bus passengers in Itabira, Brazil, rescue a woman, who was being robbed.

title: Kevin Spacey to face UK court over sexual assault charges
description: US actor Kevin Spacey is set to appear before a UK court later this week after being charged with four counts of sexual assault against three men, London's Metropolitan Police Service said on Monday.

title: Strange tsunami-like quakes shake some of the stars in our galaxy, Gaia spacecraft reveals
description: Strange and unexpected tsunami-like starquakes -- movements on stars' crusts similar to earthquakes we experience on our planet -- have been revealed by the European Space Agency's Gaia space observatory.

title: Trump officials recount how election night unfolded
description: In recorded testimony released by the House January 6 committee, Trump administration officials, including Ivanka Trump, Jared Kushner and former campaign manager Bill Stepien recount how election night unfolded at the White House.

title: Bitcoin plunges below $24,000 and the crypto meltdown claims another casualty
description: Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies have plunged, and one of the world's biggest lenders of cryptocurrency has paused all withdrawals from its platform as the market meltdown continues apace.

title: How meditation could change the brain
description: In a time when traumatic events such as pandemics, shootings and loss seem never-ending, mindfulness can be a tool for feeling capable during periods of uncertainty.

title: Former WH advisor on where President Biden's administration has gone wrong
description: David Gergen, who has worked in the White House for four different presidents, explains to CNN's Fareed Zakaria where President Biden's administration has gone wrong, and why he's concerned about a possible rematch between Biden and former President Donald Trump.

title: Think you're a moderate drinker? Not if you binge, study finds, and that's a health problem
description: You consider yourself a light-to-moderate drinker, having the occasional cocktail or glass of wine with dinner and only tossing back a few extra glasses of liquid refreshment at social gatherings on weekends. By most standards, you'd be right -- because drinking is typically tracked as an average over the week.

title: Men want pearls and they're not afraid to wear them
description: Watch your pearls, ladies. The fellas are coming for them.

title: The Scottish adventurer who's riding across Europe on horseback
description: Scottish adventurer Louis Hall has been riding across Europe for nearly three months, but the final point of his estimated 2,800 kilometer journey is almost in sight.

title: 'We have a job too': The volunteers rebuilding Kyiv's suburbs
description: Men in hard hats enter a child's bedroom decorated with pink wallpaper that features two bejeweled elephants, a little one and big one.

title: Dow sinks 800 points and stocks enter bear market on worries of drastic rate hikes
description: US stocks plunged into bear market territory Monday morning as Wall Street investors grew increasingly nervous about the prospect of even more harsh medicine from the Fed to take the sting out of inflation.

title: Iraq's most powerful politician has just caused a 'tectonic shift'
description: After eight months of political paralysis, the kingmaker of Iraqi politics has ordered his bloc to withdraw from parliament.

title: The Fed may have to do something it hasn't done since 1994 to tame inflation
description: Just one month ago, Federal Reserve chairman Jerome Powell said that the central bank was not "actively considering" raising interest rates by three-quarters of a percentage point to fight inflation. But after Friday's consumer price index report showed inflation is rising faster than expected, Wall Street is worried that Powell may have to change his tune.

title: Coca-Cola is putting Jack & Coke in a can
description: Drinking a Jack and Coke is about to become, somehow, even easier.

title: Endurance runner wins 22-mile race against horse
description: It's one of the ultimate tests of man against beast and over the weekend a Briton got the better or his four-legged rival to cross the finish line first and win the Whole Earth Man V Horse race in Llanwrtyd Wells, Wales on Saturday.

title: Jennifer Hudson is an EGOT winner
description: Jennifer Hudson made history Sunday night.

title: Amber Heard doesn't 'blame' jury for siding with Johnny Depp
description: Amber Heard is speaking out in her first interview since her defamation trial with her former husband, Johnny Depp.

title: Rory McIlroy appears to take a dig at Greg Norman as he wins Canadian Open
description: Rory McIlroy appeared to take a dig at Greg Norman, the former golfer and now CEO of the new LIV Golf series, after the Northern Irishman successfully defended his 2019 title at the RBC Canadian Open.

title: Thermal imaging reveals the lasting impact of racist housing policies
description: CNN's Derek Van Dam measures the surface temperatures in two Atlanta parks serving two different communities, and the results are staggering.

title: Tesla is trying an old trick to boost its stock. It may not work
description: In recent years, when a company announced it was splitting its stock, Wall Street went wild. When Tesla revealed such plans in 2020, its shares immediately shot up. They climbed 66% over the following 12 months.

title: Is Ukraine outgunned? Watch latest report on state of war
description: With Russia poised to encircle the strategically significant city of Severodonetsk in Ukraine's eastern Donbas region within days, CNN's Matthew Chance reports on the state of Russia's invasion.

title: Discord at Supreme Court mirrors diminishment of democratic norms
description: Supreme Court justices are facing protests from outside their newly fortified perimeter -- and from within -- as they finish an epic session destined to transform the law in America.

title: Linn Grant makes history as first female winner on DP World Tour
description: Linn Grant made history on Sunday as she became the first female winner on the DP World Tour.

title: Ikea is considering closing another store in China
description: Ikea has already shut one store in mainland China this year and could close another in Shanghai in early July.

title: PGA Tour commissioner Jay Monahan reflects on 'unfortunate week' following launch of LIV Golf series
description: PGA Tour commissioner Jay Monahan called the launch of the controversial LIV Golf series an "unfortunate week that was created by some unfortunate decisions."

title: World's nuclear arsenals on the rise as concerns grow over China and North Korea
description: The world's biggest powers might have once pledged to work toward a world without nuclear weapons, but global stockpiles are expected to rise over the coming decade, according to a new report.

title: Video of women being brutally attacked sparks public outrage in China
June's strawberry moon will light up the sky this week
description: June's full moon, the strawberry moon, will illuminate the sky this week.

title: Macron's centrists edge ahead of left in French first round vote
description: French President Emmanuel Macron's centrist alliance won the first round of lower house elections on Sunday by a razor-thin margin over the left bloc of Jean-Luc Melenchon, but is likely to extend its lead in next weekend's second-round runoff.

title: Australian columnist admits mistakes in Rebel Wilson 'outing' controversy
description: An Australian newspaper columnist has apologized for a story that appeared to accuse actor Rebel Wilson of spoiling his attempts to out her as gay.

title: China sees Pacific islands as 'equals', US sees a 'backyard', claims Beijing's former envoy
description: China's former ambassador to the United States claims Western countries are treating the South Pacific like their "backyard" in a throwback to the colonial era, while Beijing sees the small island nations as equals.

title: Senate compromise on guns is a real breakthrough
description: Ten Republican senators appear ready to answer pleas from anguished relatives of recent mass shootings to "do something" by defying their own party's dogma on gun reforms.

title: Indian officials demolish several houses after protests over anti-Islam remarks
description: Authorities in India's Uttar Pradesh state have demolished the homes of several people accused of involvement in riots last week triggered by derogatory remarks made by ruling party figures about Islam's Prophet Mohammad, officials said on Sunday.

title: Fiji says Asia's biggest security threat is climate change, not conflict
description: Fiji's defense minister said on Sunday that climate change posed the biggest security threat in the Asia-Pacific region, a shift in tone at a defense summit dominated by the war in Ukraine and disputes between China and the United States.
